sip_features.sip_feature:
HTML

RTL Updates:

HSDs:
1. 1207325972 "FWD (PCR) Follow-on to SBR Parity Support - add parity checking on internal datapath": In continuation of the original parity PCR (1204688340) where the parity checking/generation was restricted to SBR boundaries, this feature enables internal checking and generation of parity in SBR datapath. Parity is checked at the output of queues (just after data is stored and retrieved). Ports within a router (SBR) need to follow the integration guide and IOSF spec rules to propagate parity, since certain ports could choose not to have parity enabled. Parity err out will be seen at the outputs of the ports that have parity enabled, which will follow all the rules of fabric handling as per IOSF spec.
2. 1204688535 "FWD (PCR) Gen2.1r5: Enable SBR backbone to change widths from router to router ": There routers in the network can now support variable external data path width. There is no more restriction on the widths to be same across all the routers in a network. Added for optimizing routers.
3. 1404739901 "FWD router table inconsistency after adding new ports to pmsb fabric ": Incorrect portmap generation for configs with num_endpoints+num_routers > 254, due to incorrect sizing of 2 arrays in sbccfg.c
4. 1404760982 "Incorrect generation of the case statement for MI table selection": Incorrect generation of the case statement for MI table selection, when router names differ only in numeric characters.

sip_knissues.sip_knissue:
HTML

"SVC does not scale for fabrics with more than 100 nodes" :

sip_speccons.sip_speccon:
HTML

Integration Notes:

NOTE: CTECH_LIB_NAME must point to a valid synthesisable CTECH library when synthesising the IP.

NOTE: CTECH_LIB_NAME must point to a valid synthesisable/behavior CTECH library when simulating the IP.

sip_specins.sip_specin:
HTML

This SBR release uses the latest version of SVC

For support file an HSD at https://hsdes.intel.com/home/default.html#magazine?id=101846185&contentId=1012194360

The first endpoint release with support for parity pins is IOSF_Sideband_Endpoint_ALL_2014WW31_R1p0_v5.

The Zircon scores are uploaded to the IPDS dashboard for the SBR IP at https://zircon.fm.intel.com/zircon/zircon/zirconReleaseDashboardTable.php?top_filter_checkbox=0&Proj_id=12904&IP_id=17319&milestone_filter=4&Ver_id=all&App_id=all&showlatest=0
